title: What to Write in a Baby Shower Book: 50+ Message Tips & Examples

steps.title: Write a cute, encouraging personal message for the new baby.
steps.content: Write a cute, encouraging personal message for the new baby. When you prefer to keep things simple, just craft a short note from the heart. Express how much you care and offer them a few uplifting comments designed to warm the reader’s heart whenever they pick up the book. [1] X Research source “Here’s to new life! Little one, I cannot wait to watch you grow up.” “So excited that you’re on your way. Welcome, little one!” “You’re in my heart already, and I’ll always be here for you!” “May you always find joy and love in your life.”

steps.title: Craft a message that specifically references the book you bought.
steps.content: Craft a message that specifically references the book you bought. If you picked out a particular book because it’s special to you or you love the message it sends, include that reasoning in your note. For example, the above message (“Think of your wonderful journey ahead!”) is a fitting note to write Dr. Seuss’s Oh, The Places You’ll Go!' [2] X Research source “Just like this hungry caterpillar, I hope your appetite for life and love only grows with time!” ( The Very Hungry Caterpillar by Eric Carle) “Let this book remind you that there’s no place like home, sweet child!” ( The Wonderful Wizard of Oz by L. Frank Baum) “Remember that friends are the most valuable gifts you can get in life. Treasure them—and go on many fun adventures!” ( Winnie the Pooh by A. A. Milne)

steps.title: Borrow inspiration from writers and use a famous book quote.
steps.content: Borrow inspiration from writers and use a famous book quote. It’s okay if words aren’t your strong suit; luckily, there’s a long history of writers who have already put pen to paper. The above quote is from Emily Winfield Martin, and there are many others to choose from. Inscribe a quote from a famous author inside the book! [3] X Research source “Wishing you many nights of bedtime stories and sweet dreams.” – Jane Dyer "Wonderful baby, wish upon a star. Never forget you are loved for who you are." – Amy Krouse Rosenthal “The journey of a lifetime starts with the turning of a page.” – Rachel Anders “Don’t just fly, soar” – Walt Disney “I’ll love you forever, I’ll like you for always. As long as I’m living, my baby you’ll be.” – Robert Munsch

steps.title: Include a sweet note referencing books and the joys of reading.
steps.content: Include a sweet note referencing books and the joys of reading. Since you’re getting the baby a book, why not write a cute little note about why books are the perfect gift? Share your hopes that all these baby shower books instill a lifelong love of reading in the new baby and your hopes that the baby will love the story you’ve picked out. [4] X Research source ”I hope this simple book will open up your heart to the world of literature.” “Never underestimate the power of a good book. May it help your imagination soar!” “Grow your imagination and never stop dreaming, learning, and living.” “Here's to a life full of love, a world full of adventure, and shelves full of books!” “Be the hero of your own story, sweet baby, and never give up!”

steps.title: Write a heartfelt familial message if you’re related to the new baby.
steps.content: Write a heartfelt familial message if you’re related to the new baby. Get a little more personal if the new baby is joining your family. Talk about your connection to the baby and reference something the whole family does together—or simply express excitement that the family is getting a little bigger. [5] X Research source “I can’t wait to experience family reunions with my amazing new cousin!” “Your parents are some of my favorite people, so I know you’ll be an amazing little niece!” “May you grow up to be just as smart and funny as your wonderful parents!”

steps.title: Craft a humorous message (with some sentimentality mixed in).
steps.content: Craft a humorous message (with some sentimentality mixed in). Jokes are a fun way to make the parents (and their child, eventually) chuckle when they open up the book. Just be sure your jokes are appropriate for kids! A good way to craft your joke is to combine humor and heart since this is still a special occasion to celebrate. [6] X Research source “May you cause your parents many sleepless nights and many more magical moments full of love!” “Sleep may be overrated, but babies aren’t!” “Some people call babies bundles of trouble. Good thing they’re also bundles of love!”

steps.title: Add a faith-based message if the baby’s family is religious.
steps.content: Add a faith-based message if the baby’s family is religious. Religion-based messages can be a really sweet way to show the new baby some love, so long as it matches the family’s religious beliefs. Share a quick passage from their religion’s holy book in your message. Religion can be a delicate topic, so only share religious messages with close family and friends. “Peace I leave with you, my peace I give you. —John 14:27” “Do not fear, for I am with you. —Isaiah 41:10” “Children are a gift from the Lord; they are a reward from him. – Psalm 127:3”

steps.title: Reference the baby’s sex if the parents have made a point to reveal it.
steps.content: Reference the baby’s sex if the parents have made a point to reveal it. Some expecting parents opt for a gender reveal celebration and make a grand gesture in revealing the baby’s sex. Keep that in mind while you write your message if you know what they're expecting. [7] X Research source “Oh boy! I’m so excited to meet you at last.” “Welcome, little girl! I bet you’ll have your mother’s gorgeous smile.” “Can’t wait to see the wonderful young man you’ll become.” “We’re so excited to shower this little Prince(ss) with love!”

steps.title: Write a message that welcomes an adopted baby into their family.
steps.content: Write a message that welcomes an adopted baby into their family. Adoption is usually a long (sometimes difficult) process for the new parents and their child. In your note, make sure you wish all of them well in the next phase of their lives! [8] X Research source “So excited to welcome you to the family. We’ve waited so long for you!” “Welcome, little one! You’re a dream come true for your family.” “Here’s to a lifetime of happy memories as a family!” “This amazing child was meant for you, and you for them. Congratulations!”

steps.title: Refer to multiple babies if the parents are expecting more than one.
steps.content: Refer to multiple babies if the parents are expecting more than one. Some expecting parents get even more than they originally anticipated from a pregnancy. Write a special message acknowledging all the new additions coming to the family! It’s easy to adapt the message for twins, triplets, and so on. [9] X Research source “They say good things come in threes!” “What’s even more special than a new baby? Two new babies!” “Twins mean double the fun and double the love!”

steps.title: Include a quick aside addressed to the parents in lieu of a card.
steps.content: Include a quick aside addressed to the parents in lieu of a card. Most of the time, notes written in baby shower books are intended for the baby. However, since many people nowadays are getting books in place of cards, you could always leave a note congratulating the new parents alongside your note to the baby. [10] X Research source “Congratulations on adding a new member to the family!” “You’re going to be amazing parents. So happy for you!” “Parenthood is one of the most beautiful things in the world. Congratulations!” “Babies make days longer, nights shorter, and homes infinitely happier!” “Congratulations to my dear friend. I’m so excited to meet your little one!”

steps.title: Books can also be used as packages to contain other small gifts.
steps.content: Books can also be used as packages to contain other small gifts. If you plan to give another gift , be it money, a gift card , a piece of jewelry, or something else small, you can always tuck it into the book and leave a line about it in your baby shower book message. Depending on the subject of the book, you could even get something a little bigger for the baby, like a stuffed animal. [11] X Research source “I chose a book I hoped you’d love, but I’m including extra funds to expand your bookshelf!” “Enclosed is a little something extra for your parents. Congratulations!” “This book is for you, and the gift card inside it can hopefully help your parents give themselves a little extra TLC. Enjoy!”
